item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. STEWART:H.R. 754.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article one, Section eight.[Page H820]

item.text:
Anwar Sadat Centennial Celebration Act

This bill directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange for the posthumous award of a Congressional Gold Medal to Anwar Sadat in recognition of his achievements and heroic actions to attain comprehensive peace in the Middle East.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

bill.title: Anwar Sadat Centennial Celebration Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Anwar Sadat Centennial Celebration Act
To award the Congressional Gold Medal to Anwar Sadat in recognition of his heroic achievements and courageous contributions to peace in the Middle East.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
